Articles.Content: I want to travel to Laythe and need an idea for a cool spacecraft. Got any crazy, usable, designs?
A boat with flying drones that can mine and refuel itself and the drones.
Selfish_meme's second superyacht (the one with the pool) with a mammoth two nerva's and a metric boopton of fuel hidden inside the hull.

28 minutes ago, chadgaskerman said:

Selfish_meme's second superyacht (the one with the pool) with a mammoth two nerva's and a metric boopton of fuel hidden inside the hull.

I don't have a superyaucht, you are thinking of someone else.

You might need a very light aircraft and one that's very aerodynamic.

Heres an example I made in 0.90 (I strapped it onto a rocket and left it in low KEO)

My own plan involves building an orbit-to-orbit mothership to ferry a fleet of spaceplanes from Minmus to Laythe, using a low pass over Kerbin to take advantage of the Oberth effect. Four satellites to put in polar orbits of each moon, 8-12 probes to check out nice resource patches, a couple of Mk 1 sized spaceplanes for exploration, a Mk 4 sized transport to ferry rovers to the surface with an ISRU to refuel everything, a submersible or two...

Go with an ambphibious rover-type vehicle with mining/science gear, a base that floats on water (to house crew, science labs, and ore processing), and a dedicated SSTO/cargo vehicle launch site somewhere on land near your seabase.

I'll have to try that myself now.

On 09/04/2016 at 3:46 PM, belger99 said:

I want to travel to Laythe and need an idea for a cool spacecraft. Got any crazy, usable, designs?

Actually I do

Trip to Laythe and back easy peasy
